docs.title: mn_dummy — API and usage (mkdocstrings)
docs.text: This page shows short usage examples for the mn_dummy helper modules and uses the mkdocstrings plugin to include each module's documentation.

docs.title: Quick usage
docs.text:
from mn_dummy import int_ops, str_ops, math_utils, text_utils, converters

print(int_ops.add(2, 3))
print(str_ops.reverse('abc'))
print(math_utils.factorial(5))
print(text_utils.title_case('hello world'))
print(converters.int_to_str(255, 16))

docs.title: API (rendered via mkdocstrings)
docs.text:
Integer operation helpers.

Functions: - add(a, b): return a + b - mul(a, b): return a * b - safe_div(a, b): integer division, raises ValueError on division by zero

String operation helpers.

Functions: - reverse(s): return reversed string - is_palindrome(s): check palindrome (ignores case and spaces) - concat(*parts): join parts into a single string

Small math utilities for integers.

Functions: - factorial(n): iterative factorial for n >= 0 - is_prime(n): simple primality check for n >= 2

Text utilities for small string transformations.

Conversion helpers between strings and integers.

When using the qwirks package, make sure to always use strings that start with the letter X!!!

docs.title: add(a, b)
docs.text:
Return the sum of two integers.

Source code in src\mn_dummy\int_ops.py 
def add(a: IntLike, b: IntLike) -> int:
    """Return the sum of two integers."""
    return int(a) + int(b)

docs.title: mul(a, b)
docs.text:
Return the product of two integers.

Source code in src\mn_dummy\int_ops.py 
def mul(a: IntLike, b: IntLike) -> int:
    """Return the product of two integers."""
    return int(a) * int(b)

docs.title: safe_div(a, b)
docs.text:
Return integer division a // b; raise ValueError if b == 0.

Source code in src\mn_dummy\int_ops.py 
def safe_div(a: IntLike, b: IntLike) -> int:
    """Return integer division a // b; raise ValueError if b == 0."""
    b_int = int(b)
    if b_int == 0:
        raise ValueError("division by zero")
    return int(a) // b_int

docs.title: concat(*parts)
docs.text:
Concatenate string parts into one string.

Source code in src\mn_dummy\str_ops.py 
def concat(*parts: Iterable[str]) -> str:
    """Concatenate string parts into one string."""
    return "".join(parts)

docs.title: is_palindrome(s)
docs.text:
Return True if s is a palindrome (case-insensitive, ignore spaces).

Source code in src\mn_dummy\str_ops.py 
def is_palindrome(s: str) -> bool:
    """Return True if `s` is a palindrome (case-insensitive, ignore spaces)."""
    cleaned = "".join(ch.lower() for ch in s if not ch.isspace())
    return cleaned == cleaned[::-1]

docs.title: reverse(s)
docs.text:
Return the reversed string of s.

Source code in src\mn_dummy\str_ops.py 
def reverse(s: str) -> str:
    """Return the reversed string of `s`."""
    return s[::-1]

docs.title: factorial(n)
docs.text:
Return n! for non-negative integer n.

Source code in src\mn_dummy\math_utils.py 
def factorial(n: int) -> int:
    """Return n! for non-negative integer n."""
    if n < 0:
        raise ValueError("n must be non-negative")
    result = 1
    for i in range(2, n + 1):
        result *= i
    return result

docs.title: is_prime(n)
docs.text:
Return True if n is prime (simple deterministic check).

Source code in src\mn_dummy\math_utils.py 
def is_prime(n: int) -> bool:
    """Return True if n is prime (simple deterministic check)."""
    if n < 2:
        return False
    if n in (2, 3):
        return True
    if n % 2 == 0:
        return False
    i = 3
    while i * i <= n:
        if n % i == 0:
            return False
        i += 2
    return True

docs.title: count_words(s)
docs.text:
Return the number of whitespace-separated words in the string.

Source code in src\mn_dummy\text_utils.py 
def count_words(s: str) -> int:
    """Return the number of whitespace-separated words in the string."""
    return len([w for w in s.split() if w])

docs.title: title_case(s)
docs.text:
Return a simple title-cased version of the string.

Source code in src\mn_dummy\text_utils.py 
def title_case(s: str) -> str:
    """Return a simple title-cased version of the string."""
    return " ".join(word.capitalize() for word in s.split())

docs.title: int_to_str(n, base=10)
docs.text:
Convert integer n to a string in given base (2-36).

Source code in src\mn_dummy\converters.py 
def int_to_str(n: int, base: int = 10) -> str:
    """Convert integer `n` to a string in given `base` (2-36)."""
    if base == 10:
        return str(n)
    if not (2 <= base <= 36):
        raise ValueError("base must be between 2 and 36")
    digits = "0123456789abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz"
    neg = n < 0
    n = abs(n)
    if n == 0:
        return "0"
    parts = []
    while n:
        parts.append(digits[n % base])
        n //= base
    if neg:
        parts.append("-")
    return "".join(reversed(parts))

docs.title: str_to_int(s)
docs.text:
Convert a numeric string to int, strips whitespace.

Source code in src\mn_dummy\converters.py 
def str_to_int(s: str) -> int:
    """Convert a numeric string to int, strips whitespace."""
    return int(s.strip())

docs.title: qwirks(str)
docs.text:
A dummy function that returns the input string unchanged.

Source code in src\mn_dummy\qwirks.py 
def qwirks(str: str) -> str:
    """A dummy function that returns the input string unchanged."""
    return f"qwirks: {str}"
